alert.note: Alert for Coastal Brunswick; Coastal New Hanover; Inland Brunswick; Inland New Hanover (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 22 at 8:03PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central and southern New Hanover and southeastern Brunswick Counties through 830 PM EDT... At 802 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm in the vicinity of Boiling Spring Lakes, or 8 miles north of Oak Island, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Wilmington, Oak Island, Carolina Beach, Wrightsville Beach, Kure Beach, Caswell Beach, Bald Head Island, South Masonboro Island, Snows Cut, Ocean Crest Pier, Yaupon Beach, North Masonboro Island, Boiling Spring Lakes, St. James, Southport, Bishop, Myrtle Grove, Masonboro, Winnabow and Fort Fisher. This includes US Route 17 in Brunswick County between mile markers 29 and 39. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM EDT for southeastern North Carolina.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Brunswick; Coastal New Hanover; Inland Brunswick; Inland New Hanover
